name: Panida Paethanom
intro: Backend student with a frontend background, passionate about UX/UI, clean responsive design, and full-stack development. I thrive on solving challenges, learning new tools, and bringing creative ideas to life. From chef to coder, always learning!
about: I am a Backend Development student at Gokstad Akademiet, with a completed Front-End Development diploma from Noroff School of Technology and Digital Media. After a 10-year career as a chef, working in Michelin-starred restaurants, I transitioned into programming and UX/UI design. I love turning ideas into functional, beautiful solutions and believe there’s great potential to digitalize many aspects of the food and kitchen world. Photography is my hobby—a creative skill that complements and enhances my programming journey.

learning.description: Python programming, object-oriented programming (classes, inheritance, polymorphism, interfaces, exception handling, file handling)
Flask, HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics, RESTful APIs, client-server communication, authentication & authorization, web security (HTTP, SSL/TLS)
MySQL, SQL statements, relational modeling, normalization, transactions, distributed databases
Design principles (SOLID, DRY, KISS), design patterns (MVC), UML diagrams, clean code, scalable and maintainable architectures
ASP.NET Core, containerization, cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), web server configuration, logging, CI/CD pipelines
Unit testing, debugging, user testing, prototyping, Agile and Waterfall project management
Data structures & algorithms, software performance, scalable service design, API security, structured data (JSON, XML)

education.details:
Diploma in Backend Development

Gokstad Akademiet, Oslo Norway


Currently studying backend programming with a focus on full-stack development. Learning Python, Node.js, SQL, MongoDB, and RESTful API development. Building practical projects that integrate front-end and back-end systems.

Diploma in Frontend Development

Noroff School of Technology and Digital Media, Oslo Norway


Completed front-end programming program, focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. Built multiple web projects demonstrating responsive, user-friendly design and API integration. Graduated with top grades.

Culinary Arts - Hospitality Access Program

Dusit Thani College, Bangkok Thailand


Trained in Western culinary techniques, including food preparation, plating, and kitchen management, with a strong focus on professional hospitality standards.

Vocational Certificate in Business Computer

Thai Business Administration Technological College, Bangkok Thailand


Focused on business computing, applied mathematics, and programming fundamentals. Studied Pascal, basic web development, and video editing.

experiences.details:
Owner & Catering Manager

Kværnerbyen Thaimat, Oslo Norway


Founded and managed a small catering business, taking orders via Facebook and delivering meals locally. Currently developing a website to expand online sales. Maintained operations while pausing active service to focus on studies.

Chef

Fursetgruppen, Oslo Norway


Created traditional Japanese menus and recipes. Managed food costs, trained staff, and contributed to menu photography and social media updates.

Sous Chef

Koie Ramen, Oslo Norway


Assisted in daily kitchen operations, prepared ramen dishes, ensured consistency, and supported training of junior staff.

Founder / Chef

Bad Burger, Bangkok Thailand


Opened and ran a burger and craft beer restaurant in Bangkok. Managed daily operations, staff, and marketing. Recognized as one of Bangkok’s top 10 burger restaurants and featured in Vice magazine.

Chef

L’Atelier de Joel Robuchon, Bangkok Thailand


Prepared high-quality cold dishes, salads, and appetizers for a Michelin-starred restaurant, ensuring precision and consistency.

Chef

Grand Hyatt Erawan, Bangkok Thailand


Specialized in classical European cuisine at a five-star hotel, maintaining luxury standards and delivering fine dining experiences.
